Michael de Adder was a political cartoonist for The Washington Post. De Adder was born in Moncton, NB, in 1967 and a graduate of Mount Allison University with a degree in Fine Arts. He has been nominated for six National Newspaper Awards including being nominated in 2021, has been shortlisted for the Reuben, won the Association of American Editorial Cartoonist's Golden Spike Award and is the winner of the 2020 Herblock Prize for editorial cartooning.

I can read and write braille, i can use a laptop/computer with text to speech software called NVDA screen reader. I can dj on a controller and cdj's and a controller and on a laptop or pc. I am upsessed with feet. Dont be limited by your disability, #i am the future
